turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Brown–Proctor House.
turn.2: Brown–Proctor House The Brown– Proctor House is a historic residence in Scottsboro, Alabama.
turn.4: The house was built in 1881 by John A. Brown, who sold it just one year later.
turn.6: He sold the house to General Coffey, who bought the house for his daughter Sarah, for 3,200 dollars.
turn.7: Who else has owned the house?
turn.8: John Franklin Proctor, a politician who served in the Alabama Legislature from 1892 through 1899 and was an attorney for the Scottsboro Boys in 1931, purchased the house in 1907.
turn.10: Proctor made numerous renovations to the house, including altering the two-story front portico with Tuscan columns into its current state of a single-level porch supported by Ionic columns with a central second floor balcony.
turn.11: What other changes did he make?
turn.12: A three-room addition was also built onto the back of the house, adding to the central hall plan of the original house.
